section.title: Reported speech and Reported questions
section.sectiontitle: When we report someone's words afterwards, we often move the verb forms into the past. This is because what they said is now in the past. We change present tenses to past tenses.
section.text1: 'I like Spain,' David B told the journalists.
section.text1a: David B told the journalists he liked Spain.
section.text2a: He said he was living in a beautiful villa.
section.sectiontitle2: We change the Past simple and the Present perfect to the Past perfect.
section.text3: 'I met my wife in the UK.'
section.text3a: He said he'd met his wife in the UK.
section.text4a: He told them he'd lived there for three years.

section.title: Reported speech and Reported questions
section.sectiontitle: We change will/won't to would/wouldn't, and can/can't to could/couldn't. Other modal verbs don't change.
section.text1a: He said they'd stay in Spain for ever.
section.text2a: He told them he couldn't speak Spanish yet.'
section.sectiontitle2: We also make changes in pronouns (I, you, he, she, etc.) and in place and time words.
section.text3: 'You can come and see me here next week.'
section.text3a: He told me I could come and see him there the following week.
section.text4a: He said he had moved there three years before.

section.title: Reported speech and Reported questions
section.sectiontitle: We usually use say and tell to report statements. We can use that or leave it out.
section.text1a: He said it was true. or He said to me that it was true.
section.sectiontitle2: We often use ask and want to know to report questions. In Yes/No questions, we use if or whether to join the verb to the reported words.
section.text3: 'Is it true?' she wanted to know.
section.text3a: She wanted to know if it was true.
section.text4: 'Have you been to France before?' he asked me.
section.text4a: He asked me whether I'd been to France before.

section.title: Reported speech and Reported questions
section.sectiontitle: In 'Wh' questions, we do not need if or whether.
section.text1: 'What do you think?' I asked her.
section.text2: 'Where are you going?' he wanted to know.
section.text2a: He wanted to know where we were going.
section.sectiontitle2: In reported questions, we use the same word order as in normal questions.
section.text3a: She asked whether I could come early.
section.text4a: He wanted to know if we'd seen anything suspicious.
